div.p: SCALPING, in military hiſtory, a barbarous cuftom, in practice among the Indian warriors, of taking off the tops of the ſcalps of the enemies ſkulls with their hair on. They preſerve them as trophies of their victories, and are rewarded by their chiefs according to the number of ſcalps they bring in.
